discussion.content: The hostname is set on a global level and subinterfaces can be assigned to different VDOMs, so C & D are correct.

the answer is C and D

choices.D: Each VDOM has its own routing table.
choices.B: Each VDOM can be configured with different system hostnames.
choices.A: Transparent mode and NAT/Route mode VDOMs cannot be combined on the same FortiGate.
choices.C: Different VLAN sub-interface of the same physical interface can be assigned to different VDOMs.

questions.question_text: Which Statements about virtual domains (VDOMs) arc true? (Choose two.)

An administrator wants to configure a FortiGate as a DNS server. FotiGate must use a DNS database first, and then relay all irresolvable queries to an external
DNS server. Which of the following DNS methods must you use?

choices.C: Forward to primary and secondary DNS

discussion.content:
Answer A
- non-recursive: check local (FGT) DNS records and fail if not found
- recursive: check local (FGT) DNS records and forward to system DNS if not found
Yes, absolutelly A
page 44 security guide. option A

questions.question_text: Which statement is true regarding SSL VPN timers? (Choose two.)

choices.A: The public key of the web server certificate must be installed on the browser.
choices.C: The CA certificate that signed the web-server certificate must be installed on the browser.
choices.B: The web-server certificate must be installed on the browser.
choices.D: The private key of the CA certificate that signed the browser certificate must be installed on the browser.

discussion.content: C is the correct answer. Otherwise, a browser will display a warning.
C is right
C Third party CA in this case FortiGate as a CA, its certificate should be installed in the web browser pg344

comments.content: It store the full certificate. Remember it looks revocation list, date, public key...after all it can trust the certificate

discussion.content:
ACtually A should be answer.
browser only has public keys of all CAs, it doesn't store all CA certs.

questions.question_text: Which of the following conditions must be met in order for a web browser to trust a web server certificate signed by a third-party CA?
When using SD-WAN, how do you configure the next-hop gateway address for a member interface so that FortiGate can forward Internet traffic?

discussion.content: Answer is B
BbBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBB
B is correct- Check SD-WAN Member interface configuration. there you have gateway configuration option.
B es correcta
Ans is B. Based on experience.
The correct answer is B, when selecting sd-wan from static routes the gateway option dissapear.The only option to select gateway for sd-wan is from sd-wan create new and add members(interfaces)

The correct answer is B. When you configure SD-WAN and have to choose its member interfaces, you have to also specify their gateway individually. After this when you create a Static Route and select SD-WAN you won't even have the "Gateway" field available to be filled.

B

the correct is B
B is the correct answer, I tried testing option A and C, but do not see to an option to specify the gateway address.

choices.C: It must be configured in a policy-route using the sdwan virtual interface.
choices.D: It must be learned automatically through a dynamic routing protocol.
choices.A: It must be configured in a static route using the sdwan virtual interface.
choices.B: It must be provided in the SD-WAN member interface configuration.
